page.title: 01Introduction.ELLESMERE
page.content: Ellesmere is a small market town set in the centre of a group of lakes or meres of glacial origin.Recently it has tended to loose some of it's importance as a centre for North Shropshire due to the transfer of the council offices to Wem. After becoming rather run down,the centre of the town has undergone considerable renovation.There is also a small increase in the population due to new areas of housing on infill sites and around the edge of the town. The whole area forms part of the rich North Shropshire dairy farming belt. There is a large creamery originally owing it's existence to it's canalside position.The canal in turn now forms a major tourist attraction for the town being centrally placed on the popular Llangollen Canal.
